etymologies: early 19th century: from French, from Spanish picaresco, from pícaro ‘rogue’

definitions: relating to an episodic style of fiction dealing with the adventures of a rough and dishonest but appealing hero

examples.text: a rowdy, picaresque "guys being guys" movie

shortDefinitions: relating to episodic style of fiction dealing with adventures of rough and dishonest but appealing hero
